Mason v. Coleman, 478 Mass. 03 (2017).proposition: WHEREFORE, Plaintiff respectfully requests that this Honorable Court modify the current custody arrangement to include overnights at Defendant's new residence to align with the child's best interests.

Thompson v. Smith, 455 Mass. 102 (2016).proposition: WHEREFORE, Plaintiff respectfully requests that this Honorable Court modify the current custody arrangement to include overnights at Defendant's new residence to align with the child's best interests.
Thompson v. Smith, 455 Mass. 102 (2016).support_reasoning: The opinion is an employment discrimination and damages case involving Wal-Mart under Massachusetts anti-discrimination law; it does not concern family law, child custody, parenting time, or modification of custody/visitation orders. Nothing in the decision addresses overnights, a parent's new residence, or standards for modifying custody in the child's best interests. Therefore it cannot be cited as authority for modifying a custody arrangement to include overnights at a new residence.
Thompson v. Smith, 455 Mass. 102 (2016).relevant_excerpt: The plaintiff filed a complaint in the Superior Court against Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. (Wal-Mart), alleging unequal compensation and termination of employment based on gender in violation of G. L. c. 151B, § 4 (1). The complaint also included claims for defamation. Following a jury trial, Wal-Mart was found liable on the G. L. c. 151B, § 4 (1), claim, and the plaintiff was awarded $972,774 in compensatory damages and $1 million in punitive damages.
